projectionApprox module¶

class projectionApprox.MatrixBuilder3D(dim)[source]¶

This class builds a 3D matrix from rotated projections It assumes that the data is rotated around the x-axis (axis=0) It uses linear interpolation between two neighbouring slices to fill one wedge at the time

dim: int
Number of dimensions of one of the directon of the matrix. The matrix is assumed to have shape [dim,dim,dim]
insert(slice1, slice2, angleDeg, stepAngleDeg)[source]¶

Inserts slices into the 3D matrix

slice1: ndarray
2D array containing the first slice in K-space
slice2: ndarray
2D array containing the second slicei in K-space
angleDeg: float
Angle of the first slice
stepAngleDeg: float
Difference between the angle of the first slice and the second slice
insert0to45(slice1, slice2, angleDeg, stepAngleDeg)[source]¶

Insert slices when the angle of rotation alpha satisfy 0 < alpha <= 45

See: :func:’~MatrixBuilder3D.insert’

insert135to180(slice1, slice2, angleDeg, stepAngleDeg)[source]¶

Insert slices when the angle of rotation alpha satisfy135 < alpha <= 180

See: :func:’~MatrixBuilder3D.insert’

insert45to90(slice1, slice2, angleDeg, stepAngleDeg)[source]¶

Insert slices when the angle of rotation alpha satisfy 45 < alpha <= 90

See: :func:’~MatrixBuilder3D.insert’

insert90to135(slice1, slice2, angleDeg, stepAngleDeg)[source]¶

Insert slices when the angle of rotation alpha satisfy 90 < alpha <= 135

See: :func:’~MatrixBuilder3D.insert’

plot()[source]¶

Plot a slice in the yz-plane of the 3D data

class projectionApprox.ProjectionPropagator(deltaDistribution, wavelength, voxelsize, kspaceDim=512, maxDeltaValue=5e-05)[source]¶

Bases: object

Computes the exit field after propagating across an object using the projection approximation

deltaDistribution: ndarray
3D array containing the deviation from unitty of the real part of the refractive index
wavelength: float
Wavelength of the X-rays in nano meters
voxelsize: float
Voxelsize in nano meters
kspaceDim: int
Number of elements along one direction of the k-space matrix. The k-space matrix is assumed to have shape [kspaceDim,kspaceDim,kspaceDim]
maxDeltaValue: float
Maximum allowed value for the deviation from unity of the real part of the refractive index
generateKspace(angleStepDeg)[source]¶

Generates full 3D kspace representation from the projection approximation

angleStepDeg: float
Rotation step in degree between successive rotations
Returns: ndarray
3D array representing the Fourier space
getFarField()[source]¶

Computes the far field scattering pattern based on the projection approxmiation
